title: Teddi Mellencamp's Tumors Vanish In Stunning Cancer Update
text:
Teddi Mellencamp Hopes To Be 'Cancer-Free' As She Shares Positive Update
By Chukwudi Onyewuchi on April 23, 2025 at 7:00 PM EDT
Teddi Mellencamp is delighted to share some positive news amid her ongoing battle with cancer.
"The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills" alum has continuously kept her fans updated on her health journey since she was diagnosed with melanoma in 2022.
Mellencamp has experienced several setbacks in her cancer journey lately, including its progression to stage 4, but her latest update is positive and filled her fans with hope.
Teddi Mellencamp's Tumors Shrink Significantly
View this post on Instagram
On Wednesday, Mellencamp shared a video on Instagram, providing the latest update on her cancer journey. Thankfully, it was a positive one.
"I have really exciting news, everyone," she began. "Honestly, the crying is already done, but I just finished with all my scans and my tumors have significantly shrunk, which doctors believe means that this all will work and that I will be back to myself and feeling good."
The television personality revealed that she still has two more sessions of immunotherapy, adding, "And then hopefully, I am done, and I will be cancer-free."
Mellencamp continued, "I'm going to keep a positive outlook because that's the way my doctor just spoke to me."
She said, "He's like, 'You did this, you got this.'" Mellencamp mimicked her doctor's voice, saying, '"You got that Mellencamp blood, so you're good.'"
Teddi Mellencamp Thanks Her Supporters
In the post's caption, Mellencamp elaborated on what she said in the video, noting that it was "One update I couldn't wait to share!"
She continued, "All tumors stage 4 (metastasized melanoma in my brain and lungs) shrunk or disappeared so I have 6ish more weeks of immunotherapy and doctors believe I will be healed if everything stays on course."
Mellencamp concluded by thanking those who supported her amid her health struggles.
She wrote, "Thank you to everyone who has sent their love, prayers, and positivity."
Friends And Fans Celebrate With Teddi Mellencamp
Many of Mellencamp's friends and fans reacted to her latest update with delight and excitement.
Kyle Richards described it as the "BEST DAY EVER!!!!!!" and added that she was "So grateful."
Tamra Judge, who co-hosts the "Two Ts in a Pod" podcast with Mellencamp, added, "I can't stop crying tears of joy ... I love you."
"The Real Housewives of Miami" star Marysol Patton also wrote, "This is incredible news, I'm so happy!! It was my therapeutic playlist."
A fan wrote, "What a wonderful report, Teddi! This truly made my day I think of you all the time."
Another fan added, "Teddi I am screaming in happiness LOVE YOU! Your strength and positive mental attitude is everything."
Mellencamp Gets Emotional As She Shares Pain She Deals With
The positive update follows a few days after Teddi Mellencamp spoke to Entertainment Tonight's Nischelle Turner about her battle with stage 4 cancer.
During the interview, she narrated her journey since she was diagnosed with melanoma and revealed how the disease had affected her relationship with her kids.
Mellencamp said, "I don't think you can understand like the debilitating pain that I feel some days thinking about the fact that, like my kids, you know."
She fought the tears as she spoke, adding, "You know, like that is extremely frightening. Like my kids are young. I mean, I remember one day in the hospital, I was like, 'I feel like today might be Dove's birthday,' and Edwin [Arroyave]'s like, 'It is. It's her party today that you planned.'"
Mellencamp recalled, "And I was like, 'Can they please just let me out for today?' And he's like, 'You realize you have not only gone through massive brain surgery, but you have a hole in your head.'"
She continued, "And, I just remember in that moment he said exactly what I needed him to say. He's like, 'We'll throw another one.' But, like my heart broke because I wonder like will she remember that I wasn't there."
Mellencamp Already Commenced Plans For Her Funeral
Despite remaining positive, Teddi Mellencamp feared the worst after her stage 4 cancer diagnosis.
She revealed she had already started her funeral plans during an episode of the "Two T's In A Pod" podcast.
Mellencamp told her co-host, Judge, that her dad called her to discuss their family's mausoleum and shared his desire for her to be included in it.
The 43-year-old joked that she playfully agreed to her father's suggestion, telling Judge she'd make a trip to Indiana just to visit her own grave.
Keeping things light, she added that she plans to have "Hot girls never die" engraved on her tombstone.
